00:00:01:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:01:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:01:120000.Dialogue: So what kind of cruise is this you're going on?

00:00:03:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:03:230000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:00:03:230000.Dialogue: It's called the Born Again Boat Ride.

00:00:06:200000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:06:200000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:00:06:200000.Dialogue: Christian Quarterly gave it their highest rating-- five thorny crowns.

00:00:12:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:12:130000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:00:12:130000.Dialogue: I do wish you'd come with me, Sheldon.

00:00:15:000000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:15:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:15:000000.Dialogue: Well, Mom, if I did, it would be conclusive proof that your God can work miracles.

00:00:22:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:22:040000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:00:22:040000.Dialogue: You're missing out. It's gonna be wall-to-wall fun. It's all themed. There's Jonah and the Whale Watching.

00:00:29:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:29:040000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper

00:00:32:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:32:030000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:00:32:030000.Dialogue: And my personal favorite, Gunning with God.

00:00:34:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:34:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:34:130000.Dialogue: What's Gunning with God? I'm afraid to ask.

00:00:37:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:37:210000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:00:37:210000.Dialogue: Oh, it is a hoot and a half. You write your sins on a clay pigeon, they fire 'em up in the air, and you pulverize them with a 12-gauge shotgun

00:00:47:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:47:080000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper

00:00:51:060000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:51:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:51:060000.Dialogue: Frankly, Mom, I'm encouraged to see how advanced your group has become-- willing to sail out into the ocean without fear of falling off the edge.

00:00:59:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:00:59:180000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:00:59:180000.Dialogue: For example, if Shelly was aboard, he'd write, Smart mouth on his pigeon, and then bam!

00:01:09:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:09:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:09:110000.Dialogue: The Lord giveth and the Lord bloweth away. Well, Mom, according to my itinerary for our weekend together, the fun begins with fried chicken.

00:01:16:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:16:040000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper

00:01:19:090000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:19:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:19:090000.Dialogue: Good, 'cause I got you everything you need to make it. You are in for a treat. My mother's fried chicken is why we had to buy my dad the extra large coffin.

00:01:29:060000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:29:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:29:060000.Dialogue: Sheldon, she just got off the plane. She doesn't want to cook.

00:01:32:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:32:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:32:140000.Dialogue: Of course she does. Making me food is her way of saying I love you. Making me food when she's too tired to cook is her way of saying I really love you.

00:01:41:020000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:41:020000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:01:41:020000.Dialogue: Actually, I wouldn't mind going out for a bite, Sheldon.

00:01:43:150000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:43:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:43:150000.Dialogue: Won't that spoil our appetites for the chicken you're going to make me?

00:01:46:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:46:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:46:230000.Dialogue: All right, that settles it, we're going out. Do you like sushi? There's a great little place down the street.

00:01:51:160000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:51:160000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:01:51:160000.Dialogue: I've never had it, but there's no harm in trying something new.

00:01:55:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:55:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:55:070000.Dialogue: There's a lot of harm in trying something new.

00:01:57:220000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:01:57:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:57:220000.Dialogue: That's why we test out drugs and cosmetics on bunny rabbits.

00:02:01:020000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:02:01:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:01:020000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you're talking like a crazy person.

00:02:04:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:02:04:120000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:02:04:120000.Dialogue: Actually, I had him tested as a child. Doctor says he's fine.

00:02:09:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:02:09:130000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:02:11:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon’s mother is visiting.
00:02:11:030000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:02:11:030000.Dialogue: Although, I do regret not following up with that specialist in Houston.

00:02:52:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:52:080000.Dialogue: What's the last thing you were ever happy about?

00:02:58:230000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:02:58:230000.Dialogue: This is exciting. Back home, the diner on Route Four serves sushi, but it's just cut up fish sticks and a side of Uncle Ben's.

00:03:06:120000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:03:06:120000.Dialogue: They put it on the menu in those kung fu letters, but that don't make it sushi.

00:03:12:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:12:160000.Dialogue: Uh, kung fu letters might not be politically correct.

00:03:17:090000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:03:17:090000.Dialogue: Oh, I thought the one we couldn't say was ching chong.

00:03:24:070000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:03:24:070000.Dialogue: So, Shelly, what's up with you and your friend Amy, if you don't mind a mother prying a bit?

00:03:30:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:30:040000.Dialogue: Well, there's actually big news on the Amy front. She's been studying the neurobiology of addiction in lower animals. She's this close to getting a starfish hooked on cocaine.

00:03:41:080000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:03:41:080000.Dialogue: Do you have any idea what's going on with those two?

00:03:44:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:44:180000.Dialogue: It's kind of like the Loch Ness monster. Maybe there's something there, maybe there isn't. We'll probably never know.

00:03:51:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:51:070000.Dialogue: But sometimes it's fun to creep yourself out thinking about it.

00:03:58:030000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:03:58:030000.Dialogue: How are you doing on the young lady front? I hear you're in some sort of a long distance situation?

00:04:04:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:04:120000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's Raj's sister. It's kind of tough. She's in India. Also, her parents aren't happy she's dating someone white.

00:04:11:080000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:04:11:080000.Dialogue: Oh, that's a funny turn, isn't it? You never think about it going the other way.

00:04:19:200000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:04:19:200000.Dialogue: Well, you can't force things. You need to figure out if you're in a relationship or if you're just calling it one. It's like they say-- a cat can have kittens in the oven but that don't make 'em biscuits.

00:04:32:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:32:080000.Dialogue: And that reminds me of another saying. You can lead a chicken to Crisco, but you can't make your mother fry it.

00:04:39:200000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:04:39:200000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you pester me one more time about chicken, I will put you over my knee right here in this restaurant.

00:04:47:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:47:220000.Dialogue: Please pester her. Please, for me.

00:04:54:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:54:030000.Dialogue: So, Mrs. Cooper, what did you think of the sushi?

00:04:56:080000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:04:56:080000.Dialogue: It was good. The only thing that would have made it better

00:05:00:030000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:05:00:030000.Dialogue: is if it was cooked and if it was beef.

00:05:05:140000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:05:05:140000.Dialogue: Sheldon, when is your landlord going to fix the elevator?

00:05:08:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:08:150000.Dialogue: I don't know. Lately we've been talking about converting it into a missile silo.

00:05:15:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:15:120000.Dialogue: Your son seems to think we need to launch a preemptive strike on Burbank.

00:05:21:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:21:060000.Dialogue: Get them before they get us.

00:05:30:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:30:050000.Dialogue: Hey, look who decided to show up.

00:05:35:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:35:210000.Dialogue: I couldn't find you guys so I bought six new friends.

00:05:44:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:44:140000.Dialogue: Mom, you remember Rajesh? Rajesh, my mother.

00:05:46:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:46:210000.Dialogue: Of course. Mrs. Cooper. So nice to see you again.

00:05:51:040000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:05:51:040000.Dialogue: Well, it's so nice to see you, too.

00:05:56:000000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:05:56:000000.Dialogue: I thought it was our Indians that had the occasional alcohol problem.

00:06:09:090000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:06:09:090000.Dialogue: Oh, that would be mighty white of you.

00:06:13:080000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:06:13:080000.Dialogue: So, Raj, what pain are you trying to cover up with alcohol?

00:06:23:060000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:06:23:060000.Dialogue: That's better. Now tell me what's bothering you.

00:06:28:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:28:040000.Dialogue: Oh, yes, born alone, die alone. It's a tragic human condition.

00:06:32:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:32:170000.Dialogue: Now, Raj, if you'll excuse my mother, she's about to make a pecan pie that'll be so good I'll almost forget how she blew it with the fried chicken.

00:06:41:040000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:06:41:040000.Dialogue: Sheldon, your friend is hurtin'. What do we do when someone's hurtin'?

00:06:48:090000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:06:48:090000.Dialogue: And when they're drunk as a skunk, what beverage do we offer?

00:06:53:060000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:06:53:060000.Dialogue: And what do we do it with?

00:07:01:220000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:07:01:220000.Dialogue: Now you listen to me. I know you feel like you can't find someone, but there's a lock for every key. Back home, there's a girl works at the Wal-Mart. Tall, tall girl. Woman could hunt geese with a rake.

00:07:17:090000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:07:17:090000.Dialogue: Thought she'd never find a man, then one day, wouldn't ya know, Harlem Globetrotters come to town. Long story short, today that woman travels the world with a semi-professional basketball player and two beautiful mixed-race babies.

00:07:35:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:35:020000.Dialogue: I didn't get a lot of that because of your accent, but the general tone was soothing and somehow I feel better.

00:07:44:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:44:130000.Dialogue: I'm not going to get my pecan pie, am I?

00:07:51:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:51:220000.Dialogue: Nice. Kick a man when he's down.

00:07:55:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:55:180000.Dialogue: I'm glad we're finally getting to do something together, just the two of us.

00:08:00:100000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:08:00:100000.Dialogue: Sure. One thing you really miss when you're on vacation is laundry.

00:08:04:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:04:010000.Dialogue: Careful, you're using too much Downey. You know if my clothes get too soft it makes me sleepy.

00:08:09:080000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:08:09:080000.Dialogue: Well, this takes me back. Me doing your laundry, you next to me criticizing.

00:08:22:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:22:190000.Dialogue: Sheldon, you didn't tell me your mom was coming.

00:08:24:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:24:160000.Dialogue: It was in my weekly e-mail blast.

00:08:27:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:27:060000.Dialogue: Right between Beet season is finally here and Uh-oh, red stool from beets leads to cancer scare.

00:08:40:100000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:08:40:100000.Dialogue: I hear that Leonard has a new girlfriend. How are you doing with all that?

00:08:43:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:43:120000.Dialogue: Oh, fine. You know, it's been a while. I'm getting back out there.

00:08:47:010000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:08:47:010000.Dialogue: Let me ask you, when you get back out there, are you wearing this?

00:08:53:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:53:010000.Dialogue: Well, it's super cute on. That top has paid for itself in free drinks like ten times what it cost.

00:09:00:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:00:060000.Dialogue: Yes, Penny has a lot of her money tied up in promiscuity futures.

00:09:03:230000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:09:03:230000.Dialogue: Hon, you think maybe the reason why you're having trouble finding a guy to settle down with is because you're letting them ride the roller coaster without buying a ticket?

00:09:15:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:15:100000.Dialogue: Oh, they don't always get to ride the roller coaster. Sometimes they only get to spin the teacups.

00:09:26:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:26:020000.Dialogue: Now I'm going out tonight. Would it be crazy to ask you to look at the outfit I'm going to wear?

00:09:30:010000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:09:30:010000.Dialogue: Oh, not crazy at all. And don't beat yourself up. When I was your age, you could have me for a car ride and a bottle of strawberry wine.

00:09:42:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:42:090000.Dialogue: That will not be in this week's e-mail blast.

00:09:47:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:47:060000.Dialogue: So, this spring, I get to go to the International Space Station.

00:09:51:220000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:09:51:220000.Dialogue: Oh, my word, a trip to the heavens.

00:09:57:010000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:09:57:010000.Dialogue: If you ever want to live there eternally, I've got a good book you could read.

00:10:01:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:01:130000.Dialogue: Thanks, but I watch the Charlie Brown Christmas special every year, so I get the gist.

00:10:06:100000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:10:06:100000.Dialogue: I bet your mom is really proud of you.

00:10:08:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:08:180000.Dialogue: Nope. She says if I don't back out she's going to go on a hunger strike. It would take years before she'd be in any kind of danger, but still.

00:10:17:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:17:190000.Dialogue: I've got a treat for us tomorrow, Mom. I'm taking you to see Saul Perlmutter give a lecture about his Nobel Prize-winning work in cosmology. And the best part is, at the Q and A afterward, I've worked up a couple of Q's that will stump his sorry A.

00:10:35:070000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:10:35:070000.Dialogue: I don't know, Shelly. I thought we could do a little sightseeing.

00:10:39:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:39:020000.Dialogue: What sight is better than your little boy embarrassing a Nobel laureate?

00:10:44:020000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:10:44:020000.Dialogue: Come on, Sheldon, we'll take your mom to see the Hollywood sign, the wax museum, the Walk of Fame.

00:10:49:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:49:160000.Dialogue: Ooh, maybe a little Rodeo Drive.

00:10:51:150000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:10:51:150000.Dialogue: Well, I can't spend $12,000 on a handbag, but it's free to look upon those who do with righteous condemnation.

00:11:02:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:02:060000.Dialogue: What do I say? I say you people need to stop ruining my mom's visit with your sushi, and your sadness and your slutty shirts. Stop it.

00:11:16:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:16:170000.Dialogue: He's not talking about your shirt. Your shirt is fine.

00:11:28:180000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:11:28:180000.Dialogue: The trick to pancakes is bacon grease. I cook everything in it.

00:11:33:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:33:040000.Dialogue: Everything? Aren't you worried about your health?

00:11:36:040000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:11:36:040000.Dialogue: Oh, doctors are always changing their mind. One week bacon grease is bad for you. The next week we're not getting enough of it.

00:11:46:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:46:070000.Dialogue: Mom, I want to apologize for my behavior last night.

00:12:03:200000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:12:03:200000.Dialogue: I am still going out with your friends.

00:12:06:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:06:090000.Dialogue: But I apologized. And that was hard for me because I didn't do anything wrong.

00:12:13:170000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:12:13:170000.Dialogue: Shelly, I hung out with you in enough dusty lecture halls while you were growing up. I want to go sightseeing. So why don't you have some pancakes, get dressed and come with us.

00:12:23:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:23:220000.Dialogue: I'm not going, and you can't make me.

00:12:27:130000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:12:27:130000.Dialogue: You're right, I can't. Have a nice day.

00:12:31:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:31:050000.Dialogue: Well, I'm going to stand here until you change your mind.

00:12:34:050000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:12:34:050000.Dialogue: Well, then you are going to stand there all day.

00:12:38:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:38:160000.Dialogue: I'm just gonna take my bacon grease and slide over there.

00:12:43:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:43:020000.Dialogue: I can't believe my own mother is abandoning me.

00:12:46:090000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:12:46:090000.Dialogue: I am not abandoning you. Sheldon, abandoning you is leaving you in a basket on a church doorstep. I am going to Hollywood and thank a wax Ronald Reagan for his service to our country.

00:13:01:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:01:080000.Dialogue: We appear to be at a crossroads in our relationship, Mother.

00:13:08:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:08:130000.Dialogue: All right, Mom. When you're at the Ripley's Believe It Or Not Museum, if they have an exhibit about a mother who threw away a chance to spend the day with the world's most wonderful son, believe it, because it's true.

00:13:26:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:26:100000.Dialogue: That lecture was a waste of time. I made more accurate diagrams of the expansion of the early universe on the nursery wall with the contents of my diaper.

00:13:39:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:39:090000.Dialogue: No, I'm just allergic to people who get Nobel Prizes for no good reason.

00:13:44:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:44:100000.Dialogue: Sheldon, is it possible that your foul mood-- or, to use the clinical term, bitchiness--

00:13:51:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:51:230000.Dialogue: is because your mother isn't making you a priority?

00:13:54:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:54:200000.Dialogue: No. Or to use the clinical term, nuh-uh.

00:14:00:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:00:230000.Dialogue: Are you sure? The infant-mother pair-bond is the building block of primate psychology.

00:14:04:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:04:060000.Dialogue: Oh, there it is. It always comes back to monkeys with you. Just monkeys, monkeys, monkeys.

00:14:10:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:10:080000.Dialogue: Sheldon, we're all animals. And granted, there are aspects of you that are extraordinary, but when it comes to emotions and relationships, you're just like everybody else.

00:14:18:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:18:230000.Dialogue: Are you trying to suggest that my emotional problems are no different than those of a stupid person?

00:14:25:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:25:150000.Dialogue: Actually, some research indicates that by not overthinking, the less intelligent handle emotions better.

00:14:34:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:34:040000.Dialogue: Sure you're not coming down with a cold?

00:14:35:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:35:200000.Dialogue: Oh, yes, the common cold. Just like everyone else. You'd love that, wouldn't you?

00:14:42:180000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:14:42:180000.Dialogue: Oh, this one's sweet. You know, for your rosary rattlers.

00:14:49:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:49:040000.Dialogue: Mrs. Cooper, we say Catholics, not rosary rattlers.

00:14:54:190000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:14:54:190000.Dialogue: My goodness, it's a wonder you people in California can talk at all.

00:14:59:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:59:150000.Dialogue: This is like the worst Hollywood tour ever.

00:15:01:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:01:130000.Dialogue: What are we gonna do? She wanted to see churches.

00:15:03:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:03:150000.Dialogue: Hey, they have wine here, don't they?

00:15:08:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:08:230000.Dialogue: None of our gods have abs like that.

00:15:12:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:15:12:130000.Dialogue: Yep, that's the last Jew who did sit-ups. And look where it got him.

00:15:20:150000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:15:20:150000.Dialogue: Hey, while we're here, why don't we all do some praying? Let's put a little church in this church.

00:15:25:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:25:160000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm not sure we should...

00:15:27:050000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:15:27:050000.Dialogue: It's easy. I'll show you how. Lord, Mary Cooper here. Coming to you from Gomorrah, California.

00:15:34:090000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:15:34:090000.Dialogue: I want to thank you for the blessing that is my little Shelly. I also want to thank you for the continued strength not to coldcock him with my Bible.

00:15:48:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:48:090000.Dialogue: Okay, um... Hey, God. What's up?

00:15:53:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:53:220000.Dialogue: Um, I'm good, but, uh, it would be a big help to my family if you could get my brother to stop cooking meth.

00:16:06:170000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:16:06:170000.Dialogue: She also goes a little overboard on the love thy neighbor. Could probably use that chat you had with Mary Magdalene. Leonard, you're up. Wasserman, you're on deck.

00:16:17:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:17:190000.Dialogue: Okay. I don't know... it's probably a little late to ask you to make me taller.

00:16:28:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:28:070000.Dialogue: Oh, um... if you could help out with me and my girlfriend. She's all the way in India. That would be great.

00:16:33:100000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:16:33:100000.Dialogue: Hear that? Girl trouble. Turns out we were both wrong on that front.

00:16:42:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:42:100000.Dialogue: Oh, me? No. Thanks, I'm good. I'm really just trying not to burst into flames.

00:16:53:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:53:180000.Dialogue: He says he's having trouble dropping those last five pounds.

00:16:57:160000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:16:57:160000.Dialogue: Huh, I might have gone with the talking-to-girls thing.

00:17:03:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:03:060000.Dialogue: No, you only get one wish.

00:17:22:230000.Scene: A park bench. Sheldon is sitting. A stranger sits next to him.
00:17:22:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:22:230000.Dialogue: Look at the two of us. Me, a highly regarded physicist. The kind of mind that comes along once, maybe twice in a generation. You, the common man,

00:17:35:160000.Scene: A park bench. Sheldon is sitting. A stranger sits next to him.
00:17:35:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:35:160000.Dialogue: tired from your labors as a stockbroker,

00:17:39:050000.Scene: A park bench. Sheldon is sitting. A stranger sits next to him.
00:17:39:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:39:050000.Dialogue: or vacuum cleaner salesman, or bootblack.

00:17:44:200000.Scene: A park bench. Sheldon is sitting. A stranger sits next to him.
00:17:44:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:44:200000.Dialogue: But deep down inside... apparently we're just two peas in a pod. A regular pea,

00:17:53:090000.Scene: A park bench. Sheldon is sitting. A stranger sits next to him.
00:17:53:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:53:090000.Dialogue: and the kind of pea that comes along once, maybe twice in a generation.

00:18:02:120000.Scene: A park bench. Sheldon is sitting. A stranger sits next to him.
00:18:02:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:02:120000.Dialogue: Rain. Another great equalizer. Falling on the head of the brilliant and the unremarkable alike.

00:18:17:070000.Scene: A park bench. Sheldon is sitting. A stranger sits next to him.
00:18:17:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:22:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:22:220000.Dialogue: Oh, Mrs. Cooper, it smells so good.

00:18:25:060000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:18:25:060000.Dialogue: You take notes, darlin'. The real way to get a man is with melted cheese and cream of mushroom soup. He'll die at 50 but his love will be true.

00:18:39:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:39:010000.Dialogue: I need a tissue. This one got wet.

00:18:45:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:45:170000.Dialogue: Thank you. Yeah, I've learned something today. You and I, in so many ways, other than intelligence and what counts, we're the same.

00:19:01:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:01:060000.Dialogue: I hope so, because if this is well, life isn't worth living.

00:19:04:060000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:19:04:060000.Dialogue: Oh, sugarpie, you are burning up. We've got to get you to bed.

00:19:09:210000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:19:09:210000.Dialogue: Don't worry. Mama's here to take care of her baby.

00:19:12:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:12:060000.Dialogue: And just to be clear, only her baby and not these other people.

00:19:19:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:19:150000.Dialogue: Can I have tea with honey and toast with the crust cut off?

00:19:22:230000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:19:22:230000.Dialogue: You can have whatever you want.

00:19:39:100000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:19:39:100000.Dialogue: Boy, last time I put VapoRub on you, you didn't have hair on your chest.

00:19:44:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:44:140000.Dialogue: I know, it filled in last year.

00:19:50:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:50:010000.Dialogue: I didn't get to spend a lot of time with you on this visit.

00:19:59:060000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:19:59:060000.Dialogue: Shelly, you're not eight years old anymore. We have to have a different relationship.

00:20:03:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:03:060000.Dialogue: No, we don't. The one we have works great.

00:20:06:160000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:20:06:160000.Dialogue: Sweetheart, you are a grown man.

00:20:08:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:08:080000.Dialogue: Or maybe I'm part of a new species, that lives for hundreds of years, which means I'm still basically a toddler.

00:20:15:210000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:20:15:210000.Dialogue: Oh, I so should have taken you to Houston.

00:20:22:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:22:180000.Dialogue: Does this mean you're not going to sing Soft Kitty?

00:20:25:040000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:20:25:040000.Dialogue: No, I will always sing you Soft Kitty. ** Soft kitty, warm kitty ** ** Little ball of fur... **

00:20:35:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:35:070000.Dialogue: Mrs. Cooper, were we supposed to take that pie out of the oven?

00:20:42:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:42:030000.Dialogue: Well, I know, but he means well.

00:20:51:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:51:060000.Dialogue: What are you trying to pull, Mom? From the top.

00:20:55:150000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:20:55:150000.Dialogue: This is what I'm talking about.

00:20:59:110000.Speaker: Mrs Cooper
00:20:59:110000.Dialogue: ** Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur... **
